title: Gender
data:
In *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*, when creating your character, you may choose a **gender**: **male** or **female**. You may also specify a default gender via the [gender option](/wiki/Options#gender "Options") in your configuration file. You can check your current and initial gender with [ctrl](/wiki/Ctrl "Ctrl") + [x](/wiki/X "X"), which shows your [base attributes](/wiki/Base_attributes "Base attributes").

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Description](#Description)

- [2 Variants](#Variants)

  - [2.1 NetHack brass](#NetHack_brass)
  - [2.2 SLASH'EM](#SLASH.27EM)
  - [2.3 SpliceHack](#SpliceHack)

## Description

Your choice of gender alters various messages in the game, and has some limited effect on gameplay mechanics:

- Female characters can lay [eggs](/wiki/Egg "Egg") when polymorphed into a monster that lays eggs.
- Any eggs found and carried by male characters have a 1⁄2 chance of hatching tame; eggs found and carried by females never hatch tame. Eggs laid by you always hatch tame, regardless of your current gender.
- Male characters are seduced by the [succubus](/wiki/Succubus "Succubus"), and female characters are charmed by the [incubus](/wiki/Incubus "Incubus"). During seduction, incubi will put a [ring of adornment](/wiki/Ring_of_adornment "Ring of adornment") on your hand if you have one, while succubi will steal them.

The [Valkyrie](/wiki/Valkyrie "Valkyrie") is the only class that can only start as female, although any character's gender can be changed with an [amulet of change](/wiki/Amulet_of_change "Amulet of change").

Monsters can be gendered (including **neuter**), but this affects only the pronoun used to relate their actions.

*The following information pertains to an upcoming version ([3.7.0](/wiki/3.7.0 "3.7.0")). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.*

Some monsters, such as gnome rulers have different titles depending on their gender.

## Variants

### NetHack brass

In [NetHack brass](/wiki/NetHack_brass "NetHack brass"), female characters dressed as nurses can apply [bandages](/wiki/Bandage "Bandage") in fewer turns than male characters. Female characters wearing "maid armor" (i.e. the [maid dress](/wiki/Maid_dress "Maid dress"), [frilled apron](/wiki/Frilled_apron "Frilled apron"), and [katyusha](/wiki/Katyusha "Katyusha")) gain various benefits, while male characters will instead gain the [aggravate monster](/wiki/Aggravate_monster "Aggravate monster") property.

### SLASH'EM

In [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), [Yeomen](/wiki/Yeomen "Yeomen") always start as male.

### SpliceHack

In [SpliceHack](/wiki/SpliceHack "SpliceHack"), the player's interactions with succubi and incubi are not determined by their gender, but instead by their sexuality. Additionally, players may elect to play as nonbinary. A nonbinary player character is unique in the following ways:

- Nonbinary characters are more likely to receive armor removal prompts when being seduced by a monster.
- Nonbinary characters can't lay eggs.
- Eggs that hatch in the inventory of a nonbinary character always produce peaceful monsters.
- Nonbinary characters cannot be seduced by succubi or incubi, unless the player character is bisexual.

[![This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.](/images/f/f7/Nh367-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.")

[![This article may require revision for the next version of SLASH'EM. Click here for more information.](/images/3/38/Se7e7-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article may require revision for the next version of SLASH'EM. Click here for more information.")

[![This article describes a 3.4.3-based variant of NetHack. Click here for more information.](/images/5/5d/Nh343var-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article describes a 3.4.3-based variant of NetHack. Click here for more information.")
html:
Gender

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search

In NetHack, when creating your character, you may choose a gender: male or female. You may also specify a default gender via the gender option in your configuration file. You can check your current and initial gender with ctrl + x, which shows your base attributes.

Contents

  • 1 Description
  • 2 Variants
    • 2.1 NetHack brass
    • 2.2 SLASH'EM
    • 2.3 SpliceHack

Description

Your choice of gender alters various messages in the game, and has some limited effect on gameplay mechanics:

  • Female characters can lay eggs when polymorphed into a monster that lays eggs.
  • Any eggs found and carried by male characters have a 1⁄2 chance of hatching tame; eggs found and carried by females never hatch tame. Eggs laid by you always hatch tame, regardless of your current gender.
  • Male characters are seduced by the succubus, and female characters are charmed by the incubus. During seduction, incubi will put a ring of adornment on your hand if you have one, while succubi will steal them.

The Valkyrie is the only class that can only start as female, although any character's gender can be changed with an amulet of change.

Monsters can be gendered (including neuter), but this affects only the pronoun used to relate their actions.

The following information pertains to an upcoming version (3.7.0). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.

Some monsters, such as gnome rulers have different titles depending on their gender.

Variants

NetHack brass

In NetHack brass, female characters dressed as nurses can apply bandages in fewer turns than male characters. Female characters wearing "maid armor" (i.e. the maid dress, frilled apron, and katyusha) gain various benefits, while male characters will instead gain the aggravate monster property.

SLASH'EM

In SLASH'EM, Yeomen always start as male.

SpliceHack

In SpliceHack, the player's interactions with succubi and incubi are not determined by their gender, but instead by their sexuality. Additionally, players may elect to play as nonbinary. A nonbinary player character is unique in the following ways:

  • Nonbinary characters are more likely to receive armor removal prompts when being seduced by a monster.
  • Nonbinary characters can't lay eggs.
  • Eggs that hatch in the inventory of a nonbinary character always produce peaceful monsters.
  • Nonbinary characters cannot be seduced by succubi or incubi, unless the player character is bisexual.
Retrieved from "https://nethackwiki.com/index.php?title=Gender&oldid=158966"

rawPage:
In ''[[NetHack]]'', when creating your character, you may choose a '''gender''': '''male''' or '''female'''. You may also specify a default gender via the [[options#gender|gender option]] in your configuration file. You can check your current and initial gender with {{kbd|ctrl|x}}, which shows your [[base attributes]].

==Description==
Your choice of gender alters various messages in the game, and has some limited effect on gameplay mechanics:

* Female characters can lay [[egg]]s when polymorphed into a monster that lays eggs.
* Any eggs found and carried by male characters have a {{frac|2}} chance of hatching tame; eggs found and carried by females never hatch tame. Eggs laid by you always hatch tame, regardless of your current gender.
* Male characters are seduced by the [[succubus]], and female characters are charmed by the [[incubus]]. During seduction, incubi will put a [[ring of adornment]] on your hand if you have one, while succubi will steal them.

The [[Valkyrie]] is the only class that can only start as female, although any character's gender can be changed with an [[amulet of change]].

Monsters can be gendered (including '''neuter'''), but this affects only the pronoun used to relate their actions.

{{upcoming|3.7.0|Some monsters, such as gnome rulers have different titles depending on their gender.}}

==Variants==
===NetHack brass===
In [[NetHack brass]], female characters dressed as nurses can apply [[bandage]]s in fewer turns than male characters. Female characters wearing "maid armor" (i.e. the [[maid dress]], [[frilled apron]], and [[katyusha]]) gain various benefits, while male characters will instead gain the [[aggravate monster]] property.

===SLASH'EM===
In [[SLASH'EM]], [[Yeomen]] always start as male.

===SpliceHack===
In [[SpliceHack]], the player's interactions with succubi and incubi are not determined by their gender, but instead by their sexuality. Additionally, players may elect to play as nonbinary. A nonbinary player character is unique in the following ways:

* Nonbinary characters are more likely to receive armor removal prompts when being seduced by a monster.
* Nonbinary characters can't lay eggs.
* Eggs that hatch in the inventory of a nonbinary character always produce peaceful monsters.
* Nonbinary characters cannot be seduced by succubi or incubi, unless the player character is bisexual.
